raw.title: [BIP-288] Disable last generation pool factories
raw.author: 0x512fce9B07Ce64590849115EE6B32fd40eC0f5F3
raw.body:
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/176

### Motivation

Recently Balancer contributors released a new generation of pool factories with the only change being the introduction of `create2` when deploying new pools. [BIP-253](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-253-permission-granting-for-managed-v2-composablestable-v4-weighted-v4-factories/4662) granted permissions to some of these new factories and another BIP being prepared now will grant permissions to all of the remaining ones. 

To ensure everyone only uses the latest generation it is prudent to disable the old factories.


### Specification

[details="Ethereum"]

The DAO Multisig `eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

roles: `0x0df3339673f8356288d97461676bb443e5def15e6d6e8321add702ef77075160,0xa010f28803768154a04542ff29718c73ff40e307b10e5f39fbdff6c90db7b4ec,0xe718df4ad5522c83ea7c41eb474c22b1633a63b63398fc1dd156aadd736f240b,0x3fad985e82b2b68120f2bbe4c05b3bcbb41b29519eaa63fb25cb25833043f1e8,0x50f3f826f5b6f34e6b9291e41967ce5c8f5cbd998ab8b3f740cf2bb02e2e6ea0,0xb1bb0315049487d8b225a40fc17d5a02647e84002cfa5b11eda57b967629f72c,0xdf42af2dd96057a6f29e617c9d6c389e3ac79347b2e4d0b06b8d33cd7e15c40b,0xc6d41c26426784c7fab7298da04eab2259046b3c7c8351286ee364e4e0a3bd1e,0xa29d20c33a203d4663b49d6135fd5876558c9bf107a898f7a0e95357ec2e42b1`


[details="These correspond to the role for calling `disable()` on the following factories (contract addresses included):"]
Weighted Pool v3 -> `0x5Dd94Da3644DDD055fcf6B3E1aa310Bb7801EB8b`
 Managed Pool -> `0x9Ac3E70dB606659Bf32D4BdFbb687AD193FD1F5B`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 -> `0x7d833FEF5BB92ddb578DA85fc0c35cD5Cc00Fb3e`
Composable Stable Pool v3 -> `0xdba127fBc23fb20F5929C546af220A991b5C6e01`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v4 -> `0xb9F8AB3ED3F3aCBa64Bc6cd2DcA74B7F38fD7B88`
ERC4626 Linear Pool v3 -> `0x67A25ca2350Ebf4a0C475cA74C257C94a373b828`
Euler Linear Pool -> `0x5F43FBa61f63Fa6bFF101a0A0458cEA917f6B347`
Yearn Linear Pool -> `0x8b7854708c0C54f9D7d1FF351D4F84E6dE0E134C`
Gearbox Linear Pool -> `0x2EbE41E1aa44D61c206A94474932dADC7D3FD9E3`
[/details]
 
account: `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f`

This grants all the above roles to the DAO Multisig.

Then, the DAO Multisig will call `disable()` on each of the factories.
[/details]
 
[details="Polygon"]

The DAO Multisig `matic:0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

roles: `0xa010f28803768154a04542ff29718c73ff40e307b10e5f39fbdff6c90db7b4ec,0x09c9add3c0433de33f2eeac68a5aea247cf793af4087a152235bb1603ceef18f,0x18be448c0c01ad4576befd4f6bce2abf1214dc50697f946a487657e3c3c66947,0x9592bbf1ef6b5256ed5698e4cf4610375a5e984fa05ddb8a9c6f2e411f2d0d1e,0x06efe7e891755c060de5033e398e2d4d9f1bc713591717209ef84b7e021bd154,0x5ec883ecf16774e6b304f1e06322669694ffb90c13167afeac8ed7b68ab0869e,0x6b623ee459a550297f0b0660446eef4dbf89e9d7e9d29addbbe907763506089b`


[details="These correspond to the role for calling `disable()` on the following factories (contract addresses included):"]
 Managed Pool -> `0x9Ac3E70dB606659Bf32D4BdFbb687AD193FD1F5B`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 -> `0x35c425234DC42e7402f54cC54573f77842963a56`
Weighted Pool v3 -> `0x82e4cFaef85b1B6299935340c964C942280327f4`
Composable Stable Pool v3 -> `0x7bc6C0E73EDAa66eF3F6E2f27b0EE8661834c6C9`

[/details]
 
account: `0xeE071f4B516F69a1603dA393CdE8e76C40E5Be85`

This grants all the above roles to the DAO Multisig.

Then, the DAO Multisig will call `disable()` on each of the factories.
[/details]

[details="Arbitrum"]

The DAO Multisig `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

roles: `0x0ebf042d38f8e1bb630c3010c686232d7334f90360a82eb23623fd01fbe8e656,0x5fd274813b31ce95c712e49fe755d0b075329e0579e5f04cd7126ed1470d4354,0x3f476d79932a277fc0be18747fc314f1db33802d38a900d529db018c01de81a4,0xa23cd4468cbe8403f6163d16350699bab6b407aee02d6a29755b0cffa52dd023,0x06efe7e891755c060de5033e398e2d4d9f1bc713591717209ef84b7e021bd154,0x5ec883ecf16774e6b304f1e06322669694ffb90c13167afeac8ed7b68ab0869e,0x204435acb6f76b6cfa0ef594fc0e4379b943252865ff8edb9a6d07e718ca12e8`


[details="These correspond to the role for calling `disable()` on the following factories (contract addresses included):"]
 Managed Pool -> `0x956CCab09898C0AF2aCa5e6C229c3aD4E93d9288`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 -> `0xa2D801064652A269D92EE2A59F3261155ec66830`
Weighted Pool v3 -> `0xf1665E19bc105BE4EDD3739F88315cC699cc5b65`
Composable Stable Pool v3 -> `0x1c99324EDC771c82A0DCCB780CC7DDA0045E50e7`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v4 -> `0xf23b4DB826DbA14c0e857029dfF076b1c0264843`
ERC4626 Linear Pool v3 -> `0xa3B9515A9c557455BC53F7a535A85219b59e8B2E`
Yearn Linear Pool -> `0xD8B6b96c88ad626EB6209c4876e3B14f45f8803A`
[/details]
 
account: `0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0`

This grants all the above roles to the DAO Multisig.

Then, the DAO Multisig will call `disable()` on each of the factories.
[/details]

[details="Optimism"]

The DAO Multisig `oeth:0x043f9687842771b3dF8852c1E9801DCAeED3f6bc` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` and call `grantRoles` with the following arguments:

roles: `0x0ebf042d38f8e1bb630c3010c686232d7334f90360a82eb23623fd01fbe8e656,0x172535154ede905cf4b057c617cce7d530c0610210d393844d71da28ac0e1e96,0x3e97e0a2e6079577d465a9e3898ed6097ed0c661cb291f58991b80599b0e5558,0xe59ccea4d4a98c33b7c0b3c05a3d65ff930273fa5ee03855a3104befc6d1d362,0x06efe7e891755c060de5033e398e2d4d9f1bc713591717209ef84b7e021bd154,0x5ec883ecf16774e6b304f1e06322669694ffb90c13167afeac8ed7b68ab0869e,0x204435acb6f76b6cfa0ef594fc0e4379b943252865ff8edb9a6d07e718ca12e8`


[details="These correspond to the role for calling `disable()` on the following factories (contract addresses included):"]
 Managed Pool -> `0x956CCab09898C0AF2aCa5e6C229c3aD4E93d9288`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 -> `0xAd3CC7852382C09fdCE54784292c6aB7fb9Df917`
Weighted Pool v3 -> `0xA0DAbEBAAd1b243BBb243f933013d560819eB66f`
Composable Stable Pool v3 -> `0xe2E901AB09f37884BA31622dF3Ca7FC19AA443Be`
Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v4 -> `0xf23b4DB826DbA14c0e857029dfF076b1c0264843`
ERC4626 Linear Pool v3 -> `0xa3B9515A9c557455BC53F7a535A85219b59e8B2E`

[/details]

This grants all the above roles to the DAO Multisig.

cleaned.title: [BIP-741] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs
cleaned.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17

raw.title: [BIP-741] Grant V3 Permissions to Maxis and Emergency DAO Multisigs
raw.author: 0x7c2eA10D3e5922ba3bBBafa39Dc0677353D2AF17
raw.body:
As per [BIP-734](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-734-balancer-v3-launch-and-protocol-enhancements/6168), Balancer V3 contracts have successfully been deployed to Ethereum and Gnosis! In order to both (1) call emergency functions (2) manage pool settings, it is proposed that the following existing multisigs are granted the following roles by the authorizer:

## Emergency DAO

- `VaultAdmin.pauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVault`
- `VaultAdmin.pausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.unpausePool`
- `VaultAdmin.pauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.unpauseVaultBuffers`
- `VaultAdmin.enableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.disableRecoveryMode`
- `VaultAdmin.enableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQuery`
- `VaultAdmin.disableQueryPermanently`
- `StablePoolFactory.disable`
- `WeightedPoolFactory.disable`

## Maxis

- `VaultAdmin.setStaticSwapFeePercentage`
- `StablePool.startAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `StablePool.stopAmplificationParameterUpdate`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolSwapFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.setProtocolYieldFeePercentage`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFees`
- `ProtocolFeeController.withdrawProtocolFeesForToken`

# Payload

The required payload can be found [on our GitHub repo](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1535) and can be summarised as follows:
```
+-----------------------+---------------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----+----------+
| function              | caller_name         | caller_address                             | fx_paths                                                                                      | action_ids                                                         | bip | tx_index |
+-----------------------+---------------------+--------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------+-----+----------+
| Authorizer/grantRoles | multisigs/maxi_omni | 0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e | 20241204-v3-vault/VaultAdmin/setStaticSwapFeePercentage(address,uint256)                      | 0x535f82655cb6a856d1452d97dc8e7b3393044c974f85cfcdd2c1d304c08ce34c | N/A |    0     |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20241204-v3-vault/ProtocolFeeController/setGlobalProtocolSwapFeePercentage(uint256)           | 0x31893078b6590802f57d29fae81f10113c336375df90db2aed0392af0c75d8d4 |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20241204-v3-vault/ProtocolFeeController/setGlobalProtocolYieldFeePercentage(uint256)          | 0x3bc669a22fd5eb10a81a9ab00e0cab660e6f703d7ae9185597386bbd2e849e3f |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20241204-v3-vault/ProtocolFeeController/setProtocolSwapFeePercentage(address,uint256)         | 0x93100e2a70c799f7ba831633b6a5078fc649ca0c812caa633106f1948a819155 |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20241204-v3-vault/ProtocolFeeController/setProtocolYieldFeePercentage(address,uint256)        | 0x131f9541f99a187d0a0db49756fb64345dec624e21579355e25b8b5a1b40b45c |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20241204-v3-vault/ProtocolFeeController/withdrawProtocolFees(address,address)                 | 0x4071255a8a5c23dae545fa9427571cfd2cbc2f7e623e863ec2c917ed09074e43 |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20241204-v3-vault/ProtocolFeeController/withdrawProtocolFeesForToken(address,address,address) | 0xf830de585800a430465649def91ee4e68e52ef19d8734b6836b9a2237853fc07 |     |          |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20241205-v3-stable-pool/StablePool/startAmplificationParameterUpdate(uint256,uint256)         | 0xc1d77fef06a5acef26a30536474b98eb44840e5f17e86114c8aaa4274e206b3c |     |          |

| Authorizer/grantRoles | multisigs/emergency | 0xA29F61256e948F3FB707b4b3B138C5cCb9EF9888 | 20241204-v3-vault/VaultAdmin/pauseVault()                                                     | 0x461c5a059d49bcf53ff00ff0d6fe644f40cc96ff9f6012e75ea70824dba5f886 | N/A |    1     |
|                       |                     |                                            | 20241204-v3-vault/VaultAdmin/unpauseVault()                                                   | 0xa3cc69d3a95a1b4020228f384f292c33a2db8f395442b06805d5195609d66b4e |     |          |
```

cleaned.title: [BIP-430] Enable Layer Zero Cross Chain Boosts on Base
cleaned.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e

raw.title: [BIP-430] Enable Layer Zero Cross Chain Boosts on Base
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/507

**Motivation**

With the recent move to enable the first wave of gauges on Base, it makes sense for cross chain boosts to be active on the network. As Base picks up steam, users will have an interest in receiving boost which will increase demand for veBAL. This also meets the status quo for all networks Balancer is deployed on, making the tokenomics homogenous for all network deployments. 

**Specification:**

1. 
The DAO Multisig `Base:0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x033f3ebfdc58141797e7786a8115159707118fe37ae8f6d7b98929e4465349fb`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/685c51a8fd147903939e5428c2545a3e765b5b88/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L57C36-L57C102).

account: `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462`

This grants the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

2. 

The DAO Multisig `Base:0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the l2-ve-delegation-proxy `0xD87F44Df0159DC78029AB9CA7D7e57E7249F5ACD` calling `setDelegation` with the following argument:

`0xE42FFA682A26EF8F25891db4882932711D42e467`

which corresponds to the [l2-veboost-v2](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/800d649b60f01a50f2ba620a7cb6df4f4b0d6b80/addresses/base.json#L301) contract.

3. 
The DAO Multisig `Base:0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462` will interact with the Authorizer `0x809B79b53F18E9bc08A961ED4678B901aC93213a` calling `renounceRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x033f3ebfdc58141797e7786a8115159707118fe37ae8f6d7b98929e4465349fb`

which corresponds to the role for calling `setDelegation` on the `l2-ve-delegation-proxy`, verifiable [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/685c51a8fd147903939e5428c2545a3e765b5b88/action-ids/base/action-ids.json#L57C36-L57C102).

account: `0xC40DCFB13651e64C8551007aa57F9260827B6462`

This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to call that function.

choices: No, this is not the way

raw.title: [BIP-272] Weighted Pool v1 Permission Granting
raw.author: 0x9f74662aD05840Ba35d111930501c617920dD68e
raw.body:
#### PR with payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/157

### Motivation

Vesta Finance has requested the swap fee be changed on WETH/VSTA [Arbitrum] to 1% but the Maxis currently lack the role to do so. They plan to use this pool as part of a staking/farming system. This proposal grants the Maxi LM multisig on Arbitrum the role for changing swap fees on v1 weighted pools on Arbitrum.

### Specification

The DAO Multisig on Arbitrum `arb1:0xaF23DC5983230E9eEAf93280e312e57539D098D0` will interact with the Authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` calling `grantRole` with the following arguments:

role: `0x6213e9042b9814b9567bde72d3c7a61372862c3ac88c2df77d3205221af6c871`

can be confirmed [here](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/master/pkg/deployments/action-ids/arbitrum/action-ids.json#L72). 

account: `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860`

which corresponds to the Maxi LM Multisig, confirmed [here](https://quark-ceres-740.notion.site/Multisig-List-Guidelines-402e18cff13e4f2fa571bc14ed007546).

choices: No, this is not the way

cleaned.title: [BIP-749] Grant `add_reward` Permissions to Maxis’ Omnichain Multisig
cleaned.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516

raw.title: [BIP-749] Grant `add_reward` Permissions to Maxis’ Omnichain Multisig
raw.author: 0x7019Be4E4eB74cA5F61224FeAf687d2b43998516
raw.body:
# PR with Payload
https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/multisig-ops/pull/1612

# Motivation

The action of whitelisting a custom reward token on a gauge is permissioned. Doing it through the DAO multisig for every partner/gauge/token is not feasible, hence [BIP-387](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-387-give-balancer-maxis-ability-to-add-3rd-party-rewards-to-mainnet-gauges/5018) requested permission for calling `add_reward` through the authorizer from the Maxis’ multisig.

The Maxis are however in the process of migrating their multisig to the so-called omnichain multisig, a multisig that has the same address on all chains. Over time it will replace the old one. In a lot of cases it already has replaced it; this permission is one of the last things that keeps the Maxis from moving over fully.

# Specification

On Ethereum, the DAO multisig `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` will call `grantRole(bytes32,address)` on the authorizer `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6` with the following arguments:

* role: `0x3bf29175652a3f0fac5abb715d0b7fe2e7b597e2e2eff555dac6b21a20a7c83e` ([ref](https://github.com/balancer/balancer-deployments/blob/master/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L714C41-L714C107))
* account: `0x9ff471F9f98F42E5151C7855fD1b5aa906b1AF7e` ([ref](https://github.com/BalancerMaxis/bal_addresses/blob/78e701eeca6d376b43a80684b5cfec50df0a971a/extras/multisigs.json#L11C19-L11C61))

It will perform the same action on all other chains where the omnichain multisig is deployed and does not have these permissions yet: Arbitrum, Avalanche, Base, Gnosis, Optimism and Polygon.

choices: No, this is not the way

decision.summary: The proposal seeks to grant Balancer Maxis permission to change key parameters of the StableSurge hook across multiple networks. Voting timeline analysis strongly supports approval, and forum sentiment is neutral to slightly negative but not opposed. Historical similar proposals passed with positive token price impact but some TVL declines, suggesting cautious optimism.
key_arguments_for: Voting timeline metrics show unanimous early and late support for approval.
Similar past proposals with 'Yes, let's do it' passed and had positive token price impact.
The proposal enables key parameter control for StableSurge, enhancing Balancer V3 innovation.
key_arguments_against: One negative forum comment expresses concern about permissions changes.
Some similar proposals experienced declines in TVL post-implementation.

evidence.quote: One negative comment about permissions; two neutral comments expressing anticipation or linking proposal.
Lead ratio and stability metrics unanimously support 'Yes, let's do it'.
Both similar proposals passed with 'Yes, let's do it' and positive price impact but some TVL decline.

available_choices: No, this is not the way
decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline voting metrics, forum sentiment, and historical similar proposals; ex-post tally not used.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'Yes, let's do it' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• Timeline voting metrics show unanimous and stable support for approval.
• Forum sentiment is mostly neutral with one negative comment, suggesting mild reservations but no strong opposition.
• Similar past proposals passed with positive token price impact but some TVL declines, advising cautious optimism.
• The recommendation aligns with forum sentiment and maximizes long-term protocol benefits by enabling key parameter control.
